item.title: Emily add a quote by Michael Ondaatje
item.description: "There are betrayals in war that are childlike compared with our human betrayals during peace. The new lovers enter the habits of the other. Things are smashed, revealed in a new light. This is done with nervous or tender sentences, although the heart is an organ of fire." -- Michael Ondaatje

item.title: Emily add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Never laugh at live dragons." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Emily add a quote by Arthur Golden
item.description: "If you have experienced an evening more exciting than any in your life, you're sad to see it end; and yet you still feel grateful that it happened." -- Arthur Golden

item.title: Emily add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "They play in the Meadow. The dancing girl with the dark hair and blue eyes. The boy with blond curls and gray eyes, struggling to keep up with her on his chubby toddler legs. It took five, ten, fifteen years for me to agree. But Peeta wanted them so badly. When I first felt her stirring inside of me, I was consumed with a terror that felt as old as life itself. Only the joy of holding her in my arms could tame it." -- Suzanne Collins
